metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition
metadata.section_title: Masonry and Concrete Chimneys and Flues

requirements.description: This Section applies to rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height serving fireplaces or serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, and flue pipes connected to such chimneys
requirements.exact_quote: This Section applies to a) rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height serving fireplaces or serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, and b) flue pipes connected to such chimneys

requirements.description: Maximum height of rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys covered by this section
requirements.exact_quote: rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height

requirements.description: Maximum combined total rated heat output of appliances served by chimneys under this section
requirements.exact_quote: serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less

requirements.description: Other chimneys, gas vents and flue pipes for fuel-burning appliances shall conform to Subsection 9.33.10
requirements.exact_quote: Chimneys, other than those described in Sentence (1), gas vents and flue pipes serving gas-, oil- or solid-fuel-burning appliances... shall conform to Subsection 9.33.10

requirements.description: Chimneys and flue pipes not covered by Part 9 shall conform to Section 6.3
requirements.exact_quote: Chimneys and flue pipes other than those described in Sentences (1) and (2) shall conform to Section 6.3

requirements.description: The walls of any chimney or flue pipe shall be constructed so as to be smoke- and flame-tight
requirements.exact_quote: The walls of any chimney or flue pipe shall be constructed so as to be smoke- and flame-tight

requirements.description: A chimney flue that serves a fireplace or incinerator shall not serve any other appliance
requirements.exact_quote: A chimney flue that serves a fireplace or incinerator shall not serve any other appliance

requirements.description: A chimney flue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to a natural-gas- or propane-fired appliance
requirements.exact_quote: A chimney flue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to a natural-gas- or propane-fired appliance

requirements.description: A chimney flue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless both are certified for such installation
requirements.exact_quote: A chimney flue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless the solid-fuel-burning appliance is certified for such installation and the installation of both appliances meets the requirements of the relevant standards referenced in Article 9.33.5.2

articles.title: Connections of More Than One Appliance

requirements.description: Where two or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, adequate draft shall be provided conforming to Subsection 9.33.10
requirements.exact_quote: where two or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the connections shall be made as described in Sentences (2) to (4) and an adequate draft shall be provided for the connected appliances in conformance with the requirements of the relevant standards listed in Subsection 9.33.10

requirements.description: Where 2 or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the appliances shall be located on the same storey
requirements.exact_quote: Where 2 or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the appliances shall be located on the same storey

requirements.description: The connection for a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels
requirements.exact_quote: The connection referred to in Sentence (2) for a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels

requirements.description: The connection for a liquid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below any connections for appliances burning natural gas or propane
requirements.exact_quote: The connection referred to in Sentence (2) for a liquid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below any connections for appliances burning natural gas or propane

requirements.description: Chimney flues shall not be inclined more than 45 degrees to the vertical
requirements.exact_quote: Chimney flues shall not be inclined more than 45 degrees to the vertical

requirements.description: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1) and 9.33.5.3.(1)
requirements.exact_quote: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1) and 9.33.5.3.(1)

requirements.description: Where a chimney flue serves only one appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it
requirements.exact_quote: Where a chimney flue serves only one appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it

requirements.description: The size of a chimney flue serving a masonry fireplace shall conform to Table 9.21.2.5.-A or 9.21.2.5.-B
requirements.exact_quote: The size of a chimney flue serving a masonry fireplace shall conform to Table 9.21.2.5.-A or 9.21.2.5.-B

requirements.description: The width of an oval chimney flue shall be not less than two-thirds its breadth
requirements.exact_quote: The width of an oval chimney flue shall be not less than two-thirds its breadth

requirements.description: Every masonry or concrete chimney shall have a lining of clay, concrete, firebrick or metal
requirements.exact_quote: Every masonry or concrete chimney shall have a lining of clay, concrete, firebrick or metal

requirements.description: Joints of chimney liners shall be sealed to provide a barrier to the passage of flue gases and condensate into the cavity between the liner and the surrounding masonry
requirements.exact_quote: Joints of chimney liners shall be sealed to provide a barrier to the passage of flue gases and condensate into the cavity between the liner and the surrounding masonry

requirements.description: Joints of clay, concrete or firebrick chimney liners shall be struck flush to provide a straight, smooth, aligned chimney flue
requirements.exact_quote: Joints of clay, concrete or firebrick chimney liners shall be struck flush to provide a straight, smooth, aligned chimney flue

requirements.description: Clay liners shall conform to CAN/CSA-A324-M, Clay Flue Liners
requirements.exact_quote: Clay liners shall conform to CAN/CSA-A324-M, "Clay Flue Liners"

requirements.description: Clay liners shall be not less than 15.9 mm thick
requirements.exact_quote: Liners referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 15.9 mm thick

requirements.description: Clay liners shall be capable of resisting, without softening or cracking, a temperature of 1100 degrees C
requirements.exact_quote: shall be capable of resisting, without softening or cracking, a temperature of 1100 degrees C

requirements.description: Firebrick liners shall conform to ASTM C27, Standard Classification of Fireclay and High-Alumina Refractory Brick
requirements.exact_quote: Firebrick liners shall conform to ASTM C27, "Standard Classification of Fireclay and High-Alumina Refractory Brick"

requirements.description: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, Air Setting Refractory Mortar
requirements.exact_quote: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, "Air Setting Refractory Mortar"

requirements.description: Concrete flue liners shall conform to Clause 4.2.6.4 of CAN/CSA-A405-M, Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces
requirements.exact_quote: Concrete flue liners shall conform to Clause 4.2.6.4 of CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces"

requirements.description: Metal liners shall be constructed of not less than 0.3 mm thick stainless steel
requirements.exact_quote: Metal liners shall be constructed of not less than 0.3 mm thick stainless steel

requirements.description: Metal liners shall only be used in chimneys serving gas- or oil-burning appliances
requirements.exact_quote: Metal liners referred to in Sentence (1) shall only be used in chimneys serving gas- or oil-burning appliances

requirements.description: Chimney liners shall be installed when the surrounding masonry or concrete is placed
requirements.exact_quote: Chimney liners shall be installed when the surrounding masonry or concrete is placed

articles.title: Spaces between Liners and Surrounding Masonry

requirements.description: A space not less than 10 mm wide shall be left between a chimney liner and surrounding masonry
requirements.exact_quote: A space not less than 10 mm wide shall be left between a chimney liner and surrounding masonry

requirements.description: The space between liner and masonry shall not be filled with mortar
requirements.exact_quote: The space required in Sentence (1) shall not be filled with mortar

requirements.description: Chimney liners for solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in high temperature cement mortar (CAN/CGSB-10.3) or 1:3 Portland cement to sand mortar
requirements.exact_quote: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of a) high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, "Air Setting Refractory Mortar," or b) mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume

requirements.description: Chimney liners for oil- or gas-burning appliances shall be laid in 1:3 Portland cement to sand mortar
requirements.exact_quote: Chimney liners used in chimneys for oil- or gas-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume

requirements.description: Chimney liners shall extend from a point not less than 200 mm below the lowest flue pipe connection
requirements.exact_quote: Chimney liners shall extend from a point not less than 200 mm below the lowest flue pipe connection

requirements.description: Chimney liners shall extend not less than 50 mm above the chimney cap
requirements.exact_quote: to a point not less than 50 mm... above the chimney cap

requirements.description: Chimney liners shall extend not more than 100 mm above the chimney cap
requirements.exact_quote: to a point... not more than 100 mm above the chimney cap

requirements.description: Unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20
requirements.exact_quote: Unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20

requirements.description: Concrete shall conform to Section 9.3
requirements.exact_quote: Concrete shall conform to Section 9.3

requirements.description: Footings for masonry chimneys and concrete chimneys shall conform to Section 9.15
requirements.exact_quote: Footings for masonry chimneys and concrete chimneys shall conform to Section 9.15

requirements.description: A chimney flue shall extend not less than 900 mm above the highest point at which the chimney comes in contact with the roof
requirements.exact_quote: A chimney flue shall extend not less than a) 900 mm above the highest point at which the chimney comes in contact with the roof

requirements.description: A chimney flue shall extend not less than 600 mm above the highest roof surface or structure within 3 m of the chimney
requirements.exact_quote: 600 mm above the highest roof surface or structure within 3 m of the chimney

requirements.description: Chimneys shall be braced in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. to provide lateral stability under wind loads
requirements.exact_quote: Except as provided in Sentence (2), chimneys shall be braced in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. to provide lateral stability under wind loads

requirements.description: A chimney need not be laterally braced if no horizontal outside dimension is less than 400 mm
requirements.exact_quote: A chimney need not be laterally braced provided a) no horizontal outside dimension is less than 400 mm

requirements.description: A chimney need not be laterally braced if it extends not more than 3.6 m above a roof or masonry wall
requirements.exact_quote: the chimney extends not more than 3.6 m above a roof or the masonry wall of which it forms a part

requirements.description: The top of a chimney shall have a waterproof cap of reinforced concrete, masonry or metal
requirements.exact_quote: The top of a chimney shall have a waterproof cap of reinforced concrete, masonry or metal

requirements.description: The chimney cap shall slope from the lining and be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the chimney wall
requirements.exact_quote: The cap required in Sentence (1) shall slope from the lining and be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the chimney wall

requirements.description: Cast-in-place concrete caps shall be separated from the chimney liner by a bond break and be sealed at that location
requirements.exact_quote: Cast-in-place concrete caps shall be separated from the chimney liner by a bond break and be sealed at that location

requirements.description: Jointed precast concrete or masonry chimney caps shall have flashing installed beneath the cap extending from the liner to the drip edge
requirements.exact_quote: Jointed precast concrete or masonry chimney caps shall have flashing installed beneath the cap extending from the liner to the drip edge

requirements.description: A cleanout opening with a metal frame and a tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue
requirements.exact_quote: A cleanout opening with a metal frame and a tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue

requirements.description: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick
requirements.exact_quote: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick

requirements.description: Flue liners in the same chimney shall be separated by not less than 75 mm of masonry or concrete where clay liners are used
requirements.exact_quote: Flue liners in the same chimney shall be separated by not less than 75 mm of masonry or concrete exclusive of liners where clay liners are used

requirements.description: Flue liners in the same chimney shall be separated by not less than 90 mm of firebrick where firebrick liners are used
requirements.exact_quote: or 90 mm of firebrick where firebrick liners are used

requirements.description: Flue liners shall be installed to prevent significant lateral movement
requirements.exact_quote: Flue liners referred to in Sentence (1) shall be installed to prevent significant lateral movement

requirements.description: Junctions with adjacent materials shall be adequately flashed to shed water
requirements.exact_quote: Junctions with adjacent materials shall be adequately flashed to shed water

requirements.description: The clearance between interior masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than 50 mm
requirements.exact_quote: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than a) 50 mm for interior chimneys

requirements.description: The clearance between exterior masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than 12 mm
requirements.exact_quote: b) 12 mm for exterior chimneys

requirements.description: A clearance of not less than 150 mm shall be provided between a cleanout opening and combustible material
requirements.exact_quote: A clearance of not less than 150 mm shall be provided between a cleanout opening and combustible material

requirements.description: Combustible flooring and subflooring shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys
requirements.exact_quote: Combustible flooring and subflooring shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys

requirements.description: All spaces between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be sealed top or bottom with noncombustible material
requirements.exact_quote: All spaces between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be sealed top or bottom with noncombustible material

requirements.description: Joists or beams may be supported on masonry walls enclosing chimney flues if combustible members are separated from the flue by not less than 290 mm of solid masonry
requirements.exact_quote: Joists or beams may be supported on masonry walls which enclose chimney flues provided the combustible members are separated from the flue by not less than 290 mm of solid masonry

tables.title: Diameter of Round Flues for Fireplace Chimneys
tables.description: Provides minimum and maximum flue diameters based on fireplace opening size and chimney height
tables.notes: Each column shows min/max diameter in mm

tables.title: Rectangular Flue Sizes for Fireplace Chimneys
tables.description: Provides minimum and maximum rectangular flue sizes based on fireplace opening size and chimney height
tables.notes: Dimensions shown as width x depth in mm
